title: US elections: Is Kamala Harris trying to distance herself from Biden? Critics call campaign 'fake'
Kamala Harris surges ahead of Trump in 6 of 7 battleground states
content: A recent series of polls indicated that Vice President Kamala Harris showed strong momentum against former President Donald Trump in key battleground states. The surveys revealed that Harris led in most states, except for Nevada. The Cook Political Report noted Harris's lead has increased since May, highlighting her competitive edge.
summary: A recent series of polls indicated that Vice President Kamala Harris showed strong momentum against former President Donald Trump in key battleground states. The surveys revealed that Harris led in most states, except for Nevada. The Cook Political Report noted Harris's lead has increased since May, highlighting her competitive edge.

title: Missed flight leads to meltdown: Angry passenger throws monitor at airline staff in Chicago's O'Hare Airport; watch video

Uncertain future for ISS astronauts Wilmore and Williams: Nasa weighs SpaceX vs Boeing Starliner
content: NASA remains undecided on whether to keep astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams at the ISS due to issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule. The astronauts might extend their stay until February 2025, potentially returning aboard SpaceX's Dragon. Boeing faced setbacks during the mission, including thruster malfunctions and helium leaks, prompting further tests in space.
summary: NASA remains undecided on whether to keep astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams at the ISS due to issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule. The astronauts might extend their stay until February 2025, potentially returning aboard SpaceX's Dragon. Boeing faced setbacks during the mission, including thruster malfunctions and helium leaks, prompting further tests in space.

title: Google celebrates India's Independence Day with this special Doodle
content: On India's 78th Independence Day, Google featured a doodle by Vrinda Zaveri, celebrating iconic Indian architecture adorned in national colors. The doodle honored freedom fighters and highlighted Independence Day celebrations, including flag-raising ceremonies and cultural events. Google offered best wishes to the nation, continuing its tradition of creating special doodles for significant global occasions.
summary: On India's 78th Independence Day, Google featured a doodle by Vrinda Zaveri, celebrating iconic Indian architecture adorned in national colors. The doodle honored freedom fighters and highlighted Independence Day celebrations, including flag-raising ceremonies and cultural events. Google offered best wishes to the nation, continuing its tradition of creating special doodles for significant global occasions.

title: Will Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s Sussexes titles survive? 'The Balmoral gathering isn’t just a summer holiday,' insider warns
High-stakes talks in Doha: Can US and Middle Eastern allies secure Gaza Hostage release and ceasefire?
content: Senior officials from the US, Qatar, Egypt, and Israel met in Doha for crucial discussions to finalize a hostage release and ceasefire agreement for Gaza. The gathered leaders sought to de-escalate Middle Eastern tensions and avert a larger regional conflict, amid threats from Iran and Hezbollah. President Biden viewed the agreement as critical to reducing broader war risks.
summary: Senior officials from the US, Qatar, Egypt, and Israel met in Doha for crucial discussions to finalize a hostage release and ceasefire agreement for Gaza. The gathered leaders sought to de-escalate Middle Eastern tensions and avert a larger regional conflict, amid threats from Iran and Hezbollah. President Biden viewed the agreement as critical to reducing broader war risks.

title: Ukraine says advance into Russia 'going well': New evacuation hotline and military strikes highlight escalation
content: Ukraine's forces advanced in Russia's Kursk region, creating a buffer zone to protect Ukraine's borders. President Zelenskyy announced plans for military commandant offices, and a hotline for residents wishing to evacuate to Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia ordered evacuations in response but struggled to dislodge Ukrainian troops, despite President Putin's vows.
summary: Ukraine's forces advanced in Russia's Kursk region, creating a buffer zone to protect Ukraine's borders. President Zelenskyy announced plans for military commandant offices, and a hotline for residents wishing to evacuate to Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia ordered evacuations in response but struggled to dislodge Ukrainian troops, despite President Putin's vows.

title: US Navy unveils longest-range missile: Will AIM-174B be a game-changer in Indo-Pacific tensions?
content: The US Navy deployed the AIM-174B long-range air-to-air missile in the Indo-Pacific to counter China's aerial supremacy. This missile, operational since July, significantly extends reach compared to previous missiles. It allows US jets to keep Chinese threats at bay, protect key assets, and strike high-value targets from afar, altering the strategic balance in the region.
summary: The US Navy deployed the AIM-174B long-range air-to-air missile in the Indo-Pacific to counter China's aerial supremacy. This missile, operational since July, significantly extends reach compared to previous missiles. It allows US jets to keep Chinese threats at bay, protect key assets, and strike high-value targets from afar, altering the strategic balance in the region.

title: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik resigns amid protests and national scrutiny
'Start writing that way': Biden demands media praise, critics accuse US president of manipulating coverage
Teen falls asleep during courtroom field trip, ends up in cuffs and jail clothes
content: A Detroit judge put a 16-year-old girl in jail clothes and handcuffs during a field trip as a lesson on courtroom decorum. Judge Kenneth King criticized her attitude and threatened juvenile detention to make her understand courtroom behavior. The incident drew criticism from The Greening of Detroit, who organized the trip, deeming the judge's methods unacceptable.
summary: A Detroit judge put a 16-year-old girl in jail clothes and handcuffs during a field trip as a lesson on courtroom decorum. Judge Kenneth King criticized her attitude and threatened juvenile detention to make her understand courtroom behavior. The incident drew criticism from The Greening of Detroit, who organized the trip, deeming the judge's methods unacceptable.

Biden 'most angry' with Nancy Pelosi, hasn't spoken yet; 'frustrated' with Obama
content: Weeks after exiting the race that he was adamant to keep on fighting, US president Joe Biden is still coming to terms with what happened behind his back -- 'engineered' mainly by Barack Obama, Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer. But his feeling for the three of them are different, Politico reported citing Biden's close aides. Biden is angry with Nancy Pelosi, frustrated with Barack Obama and miffed at Schumer.
summary: Weeks after exiting the race that he was adamant to keep on fighting, US president Joe Biden is still coming to terms with what happened behind his back -- 'engineered' mainly by Barack Obama, Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer. But his feeling for the three of them are different, Politico reported citing Biden's close aides. Biden is angry with Nancy Pelosi, frustrated with Barack Obama and miffed at Schumer.

title: Donald Trump said he would go to Venezuela if he loses to Kamala but...
content: In his interview with Elon Musk, Trump said he would go to Venezuela if he loses the election. “If something happens with this election, which would be a horror show, we’ll meet the next time in Venezuela,” Trump said. It was a swipe at Kamala Harris as Trump said Venezuela with is in the middle of a political crisis over the re-election of Nicholas Maduro will be a far safer place than the US if Kamala Harris becomes the president.
summary: In his interview with Elon Musk, Trump said he would go to Venezuela if he loses the election. “If something happens with this election, which would be a horror show, we’ll meet the next time in Venezuela,” Trump said. It was a swipe at Kamala Harris as Trump said Venezuela with is in the middle of a political crisis over the re-election of Nicholas Maduro will be a far safer place than the US if Kamala Harris becomes the president.

title: Atlanta joins Bengal in 'Reclaim the night' protest against Kolkata's RG Kar rape-murder horror
content: The social media call to women to come out on the streets at night to reclaim their space in protest against the rape-murder horror of Kolkata's RG Kar Medical Hospital reached far beyond Bengal as the Bengalis in Atlanta have decided to join the protest seeking justice for RG Kar incident. The protest will be near Global Mall from 6.30 ET onwards, one of the organizers informed. The protest will not be held under any banner -- just a spontaneous coming together of the Bengalis in Atlanta.
summary: The social media call to women to come out on the streets at night to reclaim their space in protest against the rape-murder horror of Kolkata's RG Kar Medical Hospital reached far beyond Bengal as the Bengalis in Atlanta have decided to join the protest seeking justice for RG Kar incident. The protest will be near Global Mall from 6.30 ET onwards, one of the organizers informed. The protest will not be held under any banner -- just a spontaneous coming together of the Bengalis in Atlanta.
